channel.title: Wireless Network Down
channel.description:
So my wireless network just went down the other day, and when I type in http://192.168.0.1 in my address bar, I get
The webpage at http://192.168.0.1/ might be temporarily down or it may have moved permanently to a new web address.
So I can't even access my router anymore. I have a D-Link 614+. No idea what to do, I'm not good with this kind of stuff. Any help is much appreciated.

item.title: Wireless Network Down
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Screw it, bought a new one. The thing was fried.
I was on my desktop to post this ps.
Thanks for the help.

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless Network Down
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

How are you connected to the internet if your wireless is down?

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless Network Down
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

TeleNubby:

ipconfig - look there for the correct address.

look at the gateway address, go to it, rejoice

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless Network Down
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

ipconfig - look there for the correct address.

On another note, my connection has severely dropped to 1.0mbps yesterday. Weird.

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless Network Down
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:12, topic:243324”]As sort of said by RXVL, but different, try changing the last digit of the IP starting from 0 up to 9.

I had this same problem untill I changed it to 2 instead of 1. I guess this is because I have 4-5 computers on my network.[/quote]

Do that.

And plug your computer in straight to your modem and see if that works.

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless Network Down
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

As sort of said by RXVL, but different, try changing the last digit of the IP starting from 0 up to 9.

I had this same problem untill I changed it to 2 instead of 1. I guess this is because I have 4-5 computers on my network.

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless Network Down
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Holic, post:10, topic:243324”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=319644.msg2532559#msg2532559 date=1226546716]
Have you tried a different router? Have you tried a different computer?
[/quote]
Nope, only have the one. Yup.[/quote]
Get your phone to run out of money (WM6) and plug it into your computer for free 3g/GPRS internet.

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless Network Down
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

runescape3dude:

Have you tried a different router? Have you tried a different computer?

Nope, only have the one. Yup.

item.title: Wireless Network Down
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Holic, post:8, topic:243324”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=319644.msg2532536#msg2532536 date=1226545374]
Plug your computer in via ethernet and try it.
[/quote]
Yup, no dice.

Have you tried hooking in with a networking cable? Have you checked your IP address settings? Have you checked if all the lights are working on the router? Have you unplugged it for 20-30 mins? Have you unplugged it and held down the reset button for about 20 seconds?

Yup. Yup. Yup. Yup. Yup.
No dice.[/quote]
Have you tried a different router? Have you tried a different computer?

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless Network Down
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Unhandled:

Plug your computer in via ethernet and try it.

Yup, no dice.

runescape3dude:

Have you tried hooking in with a networking cable? Have you checked your IP address settings? Have you checked if all the lights are working on the router? Have you unplugged it for 20-30 mins? Have you unplugged it and held down the reset button for about 20 seconds?

Yup. Yup. Yup. Yup. Yup.
No dice.

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless Network Down
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Holic, post:5, topic:243324”][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=319644.msg2532529#msg2532529 date=1226544906]
Most routers have a tiny little factory reset button that you’ll need to poke in with a pen or something like that, try see if you have one and use it.
[/quote]Yeah, I’ve tried that, and nothing’s changed.[/quote]
Have you tried hooking in with a networking cable? Have you checked your IP address settings? Have you checked if all the lights are working on the router? Have you unplugged it for 20-30 mins? Have you unplugged it and held down the reset button for about 20 seconds?

Read full topic
